channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Commercial Waste Bin Stored on Footpath, 15th October
item.description:
Unit C Maltings Court has started storing a large commercial waste bin on the pavement outside the entrance to the building. It is often overflowing with rubbish. This is a new development, with a dedicated bin store, and with an internal courtyard.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rossendale Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mapesbury road and teignmouth road, 15th October
item.description:
There is litter all over Mapesbury road between Exeter road and Dartmouth. And also loads on Teignmouth road from Mapesbury road to Dawlish road.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mapesbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged vehicle parked near 57 Tuam Road, 15th October
item.description:
Not sure of the location of the owner of this vehicle, and not sure if road worthy? Could the council please contact the owner to see what the plan is?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tuam Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Black back and litter left On street

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mapesbury Road, London

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: No mot, 15th October
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish, 15th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mungo Park Way, Ramsden, London

item.title: Flowerbeds full of litter, 15th October
item.description:
This patch of shrubbery near the railway bridge is always full of litter. Large bags of flyflipped stuff, bottles, plastics and other household waste. I have reported it on here before, as have others, but it doesn't seem to get cleared. Is the land owned by Network Rail? Would be lovely to see it smartened up. Thank you :)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen branch on grass verge, 15th October
item.description:
A branch from a public tree has snapped off in a recent storm and is now laying on the grass verge. Pretty big, but not hazardous to pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped bags of building materials, 15th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Green Lane, Penge, London

item.title: Flytipped office/gaming chair, 15th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Penge, London
